DataElement.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Block Storage Standard Operating Procedure Variation Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that describes the deviation from SOP regarding storage of FFPE blocks.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Block Storage Standard Operating Procedure Variation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04)_Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin._Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin._The act or process of making something ready._ Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material. These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
The act or process of making something ready.
